title: How to Get Download Games in the Background (While Xbox Is Off)

steps.title: Go to the home screen.
steps.content: Go to the home screen. This is the main menu for the Xbox, and what you see when it first powers on. To get there, hit the center X button on your controller and select "Go Home."

steps.title: Press the Menu button on the controller.
steps.content: Press the Menu button on the controller. It is the small center-right button.

steps.title: Find "Power & Startup" in the Settings menu.
steps.content: Find "Power & Startup" in the Settings menu. Click on "Settings" â†’ "Power and Startup." This is where you can set the Xbox to use stand-by mode when you turn it off. It will automatically search for and finish downloads and updates. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Choose "Instant-On Power Mode."
steps.content: Choose "Instant-On Power Mode." This will keep the Xbox One on standby so it will finish your downloads when the Xbox is off. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Finish any downloads that you've already started before shutdown with "Low-Power" mode.
steps.content: Finish any downloads that you've already started before shutdown with "Low-Power" mode. The 360 can only finish downloads you start when the system is on. It is automatically enabled, so if you start a download then shut off the Xbox, the game will download later. [4] X Research source The following steps detail how to enable low-power mode if you think it is turned off.

steps.title: Hit the center X button and select "Settings.
steps.content: Hit the center X button and select "Settings. " You can do this from any screen.

steps.title: Select "Systems Settings," then "Console Settings."
steps.content: Select "Systems Settings," then "Console Settings." From here you can change your power settings.

steps.title: Navigate to "Background Downloads" and make sure they are enabled.
steps.content: Navigate to "Background Downloads" and make sure they are enabled. You can find it in the "Startup and Shutdown" section of settings. Now your downloads will be enabled.

steps.title: Go to the Xbox Dashboard.
steps.content: Go to the Xbox Dashboard . Do this by selecting "Home" from the upper right corner. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select Console Settings from the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Select Console Settings from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Go to Startup and Shutdown.
steps.content: Go to Startup and Shutdown . This will show you the options for when you turn off your Xbox and allow you to enable downloads.

steps.title: Choose to download while turned off.
steps.content: Choose to download while turned off .

steps.title: Turn off your Xbox when you're done playing.
steps.content: Turn off your Xbox when you're done playing. The Xbox will not fully shut off and the power button will flash. The game will download at a 1/4 of the speed as when the Xbox is on.
